title: Mordekaiser's inherent Kit problems; VGU talk and more
body:
So, with Mordekaiser having been hit with the Rylais changes and me really questioning why I should even keep maining him I thought to myself why exactly Mordekaiser's even in this current balance limbo.
He's on Riot's naughty list and they're extremely hesitant to buff him, even when he's really becoming frustrating to play as (he's always been frustrating to play against anyways).
He's almost reached the spot where both parties are NOT going to be enjoying themselves so that got my thinking; What are the things that NEED to go when Morde gets his VGU?

http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/4.10.7/img/passive/Mordekaiser_IronMan.png **Iron Man** http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/4.10.7/img/passive/Mordekaiser_IronMan.png 
This comes to mind when I think about what makes Mordekaiser such a pain to balance.
It's a completely broken design by default and on any other champ it'd be extremely opressive.
Iron Man is THE feast of famine passive. It scales on DAMAGE output and gives you DURABILITY based on the damage you deal.
If you get fed on Mordekaiser there's nothing the enemy can do to stop you as you're going to completely destroy them without them being able to retaliate.
It also makes trading against Mordekaiser very binary in lane. Either you have the DPS required to breach his shield or he'll just shrug it off like a bad case of fleas.
It's broken by design and keeps him in this awful spot where he's not allowed to be buffed.
The sad thing about it is that it's heavily linked to his THEME and IDENTITY.
The meme "Mordekaiser es numero uno; always shield, never die" comes to mind and it certainly shows that a lot of people seem attached to this, which makes this even more tragic.
It's theme of battle-bound durability really fits with the whole Juggernaut shtick but its current form is broken.
There are other ways to fix this but I'll come to that in a minute.

**Siphon of destruction**
http://cdn.garenanow.com/webupdate/live/lolphweb/news/2015%20June/23/VFX%20in%20League%20of%20Legends/Mordekaiser.jpg 
This skill was what earned Morde the spot in the trash in the first place.
It's un-intuitive poke and a spell that has little to no decision making involved.
Is it off CD? Spam it.
It's INSTANT AoE RANGED harass that was nerfed into the pitiful state it is now.
It could be so much more but it has become this part of his kit that's so unnoticable and boring that it could be replaced by anything.
That's the problem of most of his skills anyways, they're binary, and binary is not a bad thing for a Juggernaut, but they have little to no decision making involved except his Harvester of Sorrow, which ironically was what made him pick or ban in a duo lane.
Mordekaiser needs more intuitive gameplay patterns especially in his base line kit in order to offer him and the enemy ways to outplay and truly raise the skill ceiling on both ends of that matchup

http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/5.4.1/img/spell/MordekaiserChildrenOfTheGrave.png **Children of the Grave** http://ddragon.leagueoflegends.com/cdn/5.4.1/img/spell/MordekaiserChildrenOfTheGrave.png 

Mordekaiser's ULTIMATE ability and arguably the coolest thing about his kit.
It's a curse that allows you to rip the soul out of a dead champion's body and make them follow your every whim, or rather it should if the AI wasn't mentally retarded.

It provides Mordekaiser's high point when he gets HUGE damage and durability scalings due to the Ghost not only BUFFING Morde but also Morde giving a percentage of his stats to the ghost.
That 12/0 vayne on the enemy team?
NP, it's a 12/1 Vayne on YOUR team now.
His Ultimate scales with how hard you're losing similar to old Veigar's R
It's efficiency is non-linear unlike other summons and completely relies on how well the enemy is doing.

Not only this but it does a lot of things at once.
It gives:
-Burst
-Heal
-Shield
-Potentially a huge DPS increase
-Potentially a huge tank steroid
-A sixth man on your team

What the problem with it is that it's POTENTIAL power and unlike a healthy champion's kit it's not binary, meaning unless you get the maximum out of it it'll either suck or be OPPRESSIVE as hell.
Just like Iron Man it's one of his core thematic elements, which makes Mordekaiser in general a real pain to balance and work on as a Riot designer.


**So, how could we fix this?**

Honestly?

It's actually rather simple:
-Give Mordekaiser more ways to outplay, make him less binary
-Make him less feast or famine
-Make his scaling binary and depending on HIS stats and not other variables
-Reduce the sheer lack of meaningful counterplay

Concrete things?

**Ultimate**

Children of the grave's damage, HP and other stats should be dictated by MORDE himself.
It should be similar to Daisy, meaning that Ability Ranks and Mordekaiser's own stats add to the clone's efficiency, making it a binary scaling that does not rely on the enemy being fed.
The way he gets the clone can be changed for all I care but seeing that he has to retain this in some way I feel this is the way to go to balance the Thrall he summons

**Battle-bound durability**
Probably THE Juggernaut thing.
Illaoi got her tentacles, darius his Q, every Juggernaut has a way to keep kickin' in the midst of battle and fulfill the role of being a damage threat, scaling well in the midst of battle and surviving a lot of punishment.

But how could we do this?

Well, I had ONE concrete ability change in mind that would build on one of my PERSONAL favorite things about Mordekaiser:
The Shrapnel shield, iron Man and his sheer in-fight sustain

**Iron Man; Reworked W**

Active; Mordekaiser shields himself with necromantic energies and unleashes a torrent of malice and metal around himself, the Shroud damaging surrounding enemies. (Shield strength based on %HP)

(Reactivation; Implodes the metal storm to drain the surrounding area of life, healing Mordekaiser for a percentage(?) of his max HP for every unit struck, half as efficient against minions??)

I wanted to move Iron man to an active, giving Mordekaiser more control over how he should use his survival tool, giving him a way to reflect incoming damage conscuiously and giving him a way to survive even outside combat.

The cooldown would be somewhere around 20-15 seconds but here comes the kicker:
Every time Mordekaiser is damaged by an enemy champion or monster the Cooldown of Iron Man is reduced by (1-1.25-1.5-1.75-2) seconds, half as effective against monsters

This would give Mordekaiser a tool to keep fighting in the midst of battle, his survivability still bound to actual brawling and not to simply dealing damage.
But then again, I'm not a Rioter so this may be too freaky to even implement.


The fact remains; Mordekaiser has inherent design flaws that keep him from ever being allowed to be STRONG.

His Kit is a balancing nightmare and he lacks all the aspects of a healthy Kit, lacking Windows of Power, binary scaling and ways to outplay opponents or be outplayed.

I just hope Riot finally comes around to give Mordekaiser the VGU he so DESPERATELY needs, seeing that his core THEMES and IDENTITY are some of the coolest things about him as a character and once expanded upon; Oh baby; he'd be one of the most awesome Champions in the LoL roster.

Who wouldn't want to play an updated Murder Emperor?
A Metal tyrant who rips the souls out of his enemies and goes to town with necromantic powers, ensorcelled mace, his sheer presence of malice and the will to DOMINATE and CONQUER!
He's got the potential to be bloody awesome!
http://www2.pic-upload.de/img/32272229/mordewallpaper.jpg

Hey Malicious, great topic.

I wanted to pipe in as a Kog main who has often found myself on the receiving end of Mord's Ult, especially having lived through the older incarnations of Mord down through the Seasons.

When he blasts you with that thing, you're either skunked or you're not.  Either you manage to escape with your life and Mord gets a cooldown for his trouble, or you eat it and he gets his ghost.  I think that, perhaps, instead of just being this giant nuke, why not focus it even MORE on his soul-stealing aspect while giving it a bit more interaction on the receiving end?

**R - Children of the Grave:** Mord rips out part of the soul of his target, dealing magic damage to them and creating a phantasm of the target under his control.  The phantasm gains (percentage) increased damage against its twin.  If the victim of Children of the Grave is killed before the duration expires, the phantasm is empowered, greatly increasing its lifespan and granting bonus stats to both Mord and the phantasm.

So Mord always gets a ghost to play with and if he kills the ghost's twin, then the ghost gobbles up the rest of the twin's soul and Mord gets his full-powered ghost to cause some havoc with.  I think this would resonate really well with Mord's character while giving the target more room to play around it AND giving it more of a sustained damage pattern rather than being *just* a giant nuke if it doesn't kill the target.

Thoughts?

This is something that went through my mind on numerous occasions but your elaboration rally sold me on this idea.

Currently Morde either wins or loses, getting either a powerful clone or he...doesn't.
It's hit or miss and him literally gripping a piece of your soul and ripping it out could give him more ways to express his strengths and soul-stealing aspects.

It would also provide benefits without having to outright murder someone.
How it currently stands his ult is a "win-more" ability, if your team manages to draw fist blood you just wipe them all out, which only increases the amount of binary aspects in his kit.

So yeah, it's an idea worth exploring as it would also be extremely badass and fit thematically.

Also, how's Koggles currently faring? haven't seen one in ages D:

> [{quoted}](name=Malicious Metal,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=sR8InejI,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2016-12-11T00:52:29.384+0000)

Glad you liked it!  I've always been a fan of focusing more on champion design rather than just the raw numbers.  For Morde, the question is 'how do we make him more fun to play both as AND against?'  Always giving him some soul-stealing high points with his Ult in place of a simple giant nuke would pull that off pretty well, I think.  A ghost is easier to interact with than a targeted nuke/dot is.  You can focus the ghost down quickly or disengage until it's gone.  But short of pre-nerf QSS, there wasn't ever any way to deal with Morde's Ult aside from being tanky enough to soak it.

> Also, how's Koggles currently faring? haven't seen one in ages D:

He's still super unpopular.  AP Kog has been *really* strong for a while, but the recent patch really took him down a peg.  The removal of Locket's MR aura helped him out a fair bit, as did the recent item changes and his W buff.

Though, really, I still think buffing his W damage is pretty much the worst way to buff Marksmen Kog.  All it does is make him stat-check people harder.  I would rather see more of his power budget sunk into his ability to shred resistance.  Giving him the niche of THE damage amp Marksmen would be a fun and compelling way to go.  So he would be  the team focused tank-buster while Vayne is purely selfish.

Morde's ult is kind of useless sometimes because the clone's AI is rudimentary.
AA champions that get killed and revived, benefit from this simplicity as the stats those champions buy boost their AAs, which is the most complicated thing the AI can do.

Spellcasters that get killed on the other hand, just transfer a portion of their power to Morde, basically accomplishing nothing in terms getting a spooky ghost that's going to kill people, you just use it to tank towers or dragon/herald/baron.

I feel that if Morde's ult is going to work properly and feel satisfying on using it on anyone,
spellcasting/enchanting types of champions need to be figured out. Their abilities need to work. Just imagine reviving that Soraka and having her heal your team while the enemy team loses that healer. Or imagine reviving that Talon and him just going ham on the enemy!

_**Just imagine that Morde actually strategically ulties an enemy champion and Morde rips the strength from the enemy team and for a time, makes it his team's strength.**_ But the limitation is that the clones cannot use ults themselves.

That would pretty much make him impossible to duel if his ult is off CD.  Literally no champion could deal with that, outside of maybe Illaoi getting an E off on either the clone or Morde and ulting all 3 of them.

Well let's address your general points.

<Iron man passive is broken by design>

No it's not. "Shield for damage" fundamentally is no different than lifesteal which is "heals for damage", but is actually worse, since you have to spend health to use it, and it decays, where HP's gained from lifesteal do not.

<Siphon of destruction is instant, and mindless to use>

The same could be said of any ranged damage ability, including ranged auto attacks from marksmen. Why is it that marksmen get a pass for on click undodgeable ranged damage, but Mordekaiser's cooldown-based siphon is somehow a bad thing? This is a blatant double standard that makes no sense whatsoever, particularly given that Mordekaiser lacks CC and mobility, meaning his ability to force confrontations is very limited.

<Mordekaiser ult has a variable level of potential benefit making it difficult to balance>

To some extent this is true, but this should be the reward he gets, given the sheer amount of stuff he's traded out for this powerful ability. What has he lost for this?

-Utility
-CC
-Mobility
-Range

Now granted, the power of his ultimate is somewhat contingent on who his target is, but turnaround power is part of Mordekaiser's strength, and frankly there aren't enough abilities in the game contingent on scaling off of enemy stats.

> **So, how could we fix this?**
> 
> Honestly?
> 
> It&#039;s actually rather simple:
> -Give Mordekaiser more ways to outplay, make him less binary
> -Make him less feast or famine
> -Make his scaling binary and depending on HIS stats and not other variables
> -Reduce the sheer lack of meaningful counterplay

Well, I don't know how you'd accomplish any of this without giving him actual utility and CC, and I don't buy the counterplay argument for a second, as the very nature of his kit makes him fundamentally counterplayable by design - he has no way to force a confrontation the enemy doesn't have to have.

> Concrete things?

Ok?
 
> **Ultimate**
> 
> Children of the grave&#039;s damage, HP and other stats should be dictated by MORDE himself.
> It should be similar to Daisy, meaning that Ability Ranks and Mordekaiser&#039;s own stats add to the clone&#039;s efficiency, making it a binary scaling that does not rely on the enemy being fed.
> The way he gets the clone can be changed for all I care but seeing that he has to retain this in some way I feel this is the way to go to balance the Thrall he summons

This is a terrible idea, and pushes him even FURTHER into feast or famine territory. This basically means, if he has items his ult wrecks, if he falls behind it's useless - whereas the current ultimate will always provide him benefit, either from his stats stacked on the ghost, or the ghost stats onto his.

> **Iron Man; Reworked W**
> 
> Active; Mordekaiser shields himself with necromantic energies and unleashes a torrent of malice and metal around himself, the Shroud damaging surrounding enemies. (Shield strength based on %HP)
> 
> (Reactivation; Implodes the metal storm to drain the surrounding area of life, healing Mordekaiser for a percentage(?) of his max HP for every unit struck, half as efficient against minions??)

I don't like this either. Mordekaiser should _never_ scale off of max HP for anything. Forcing him to build HP to power his shield defeats the whole point of having a shield, as the shield IS his hp that he's losing in combat - changing Iron Man to be Max HP based was the second worst change that came out of the juggernaut update.

> I wanted to move Iron man to an active, giving Mordekaiser more control over how he should use his survival tool, giving him a way to reflect incoming damage conscuiously and giving him a way to survive even outside combat.

I don't really see the need or point of this - iron man is Mordekaiser's Life Steal ability: it's what keeps him going by doing damage. Much like life steal is a passive stat, morekaisers iron man works best when it's just always on.

> His Kit is a balancing nightmare and he lacks all the aspects of a healthy Kit, lacking Windows of Power, binary scaling and ways to outplay opponents or be outplayed.

I think this is the main problem with your analysis of Mordekaiser; the above statement is factually inaccurate. This is not a 1v1 dueling game, it's a team strategy game. Mordekaiser's counterplay was always being attacked by multiple people for as long as he was a thing, as he had no choice but to push the lane and be super aggressive.

As far as Windows of Power are concerned, that's not really fun or engaging game design as it's basically an arbitrary lock on the player saying "okay now you can do stuff for the next 3 seconds" followed by "okay now you're worthless for the next 15 seconds". Thanks but no thanks.

@JedenVojak

I think what will mostly address your thoughts on this is that

a.) You can't compare a juggernaut to a marksman. You can't compare a juggernaut to a mage. You can compare a juggernaut to another juggernaut though, which you haven't done...

b.) Riot intentionally pushes the idea of "windows of power." As team strategy game, a balanced Morde based on your counterplay design of "just always 2v1 him," would inherently make him broken, since you would HAVE to devote extra resources to fighting just him, no matter what. That's why he stays weak. Windows of power are important and core to League since it's inception. That's why champion abilities have cooldowns (think about that).

**And as a general comment** (in life, not just online), instead of saying "You can't do this. Your idea sucks. This wouldn't work." you should offer some sort of alternate solution. You spent a pretty decent amount of time writing that, but all you really said was "No." You wasted a whole bunch of your time, and didn't really get anything out of it.

Anyway, I've been doing a lot of thinking about Mordekaiser myself, and some things I'd like to see happen. I'm not nearly dedicated to Mord as you are (I've said repeatedly I despise his current kit and playstyle)

passive:
- Limit his shield to only activate when it's filled up. It should be harder to stack up but once he activates it, all of Mordekaiser's damage (includes autos) feeds a portion of the damage to the shield until it's destroyed, and then it resets. This way he's got to work more for it, but once it pops it's a lot easier to keep up. 

- Possibly push some of his damage capability into his passive too. I'm a very big fan of Zarya and how she works (the only hero I like in Overwatch, matter of fact) and I think something similar would be really epic for Mord. His damage starts out fairly modest (still high because he's a juggernaut) but as he fills up his meter his damage starts to climb, he gets AoEs on his Q, he gets bigger, stuff like that. If this were the case I feel it'd have to replace his shield as a passive because it'd get too hard to keep track of two things on one resource, but we could move that to his W like you suggested. This is a pretty far-out change but I've been really liking the thought of it myself, since it means he could actually build fairly tanky and still be the heavy carry he's meant to be, and I think it suits his fantasy well. 

Siphon of Destruction:
- I think this spell should be a strong DPS ability, followed up with burst (or a stun, maybe) if a condition is met. Say, like a short channel (uninterruptable maybe?) where he drains the life out of everything in the same cone he's got now.  If it reaches a threshold then he can reactivate it to strike the same area with a lot of damage and a stun. He can't use any other attack commands without canceling it, but it offers up strong sustain (that you can walk out of to stop healing him) and if he uses it well then he gets to take that charge and smash you with it. I want it to feel like an actual siphon, rather than just the instant poke he's got currently.

So i've read your complaint about morde kit and since i like to design new champions or rework i'm giving MK a try i hope you'll like it:D

English is not my native tongue so be forgiving about that please, i'm no power point artist either and all of my ideas are just ideas on paper they're just here to say « what if ? »
numbers are highly questionnable without testing so i focus more on the design than rather if the swing need a 250 damage or a 310 damage

As a rule while making a rework i prioritize 1) the sub class aimed 2) the theme/feeling 3) a unique mechanism 4) pre-existing mechanism 5) the rest
So pre-existing mechnaism are pretty low 

_**The sub class for MK ? Juggernaut ofc you pretty much all wants that for him**_

juggernaut, my definition, strength and weaknesses :
- melee, very low range damage
- high damage 1v1
- high damage in teamfight if left untouched
- durable, good base defense + strong sustain 
- No form of dash/charge/lunge or any form of replacement ability
- very short window of stickiness
- about movement and cc : juggernauts appear slow but they are not they just dont dash/charge/lunge but they « feel » slowy what should be more apporpriate is that they are steady, you see them closing on you 
same goes for cc they do have cc but they use it has a way to gap close and not a way to generate damage advantage
- a range « pressure » spell that makes them viable against range opponent
their « window » of power is initiated by that pressure spell that provides them a short period of assured melee range on their target and due to their lack of stickiness the window closes when the opponent simply flee
again this only works if they are the strongest at melee range
the pressure spell can either be : Darius' grab, Nasus' slow, Trundle's pillar, Illaoi's grab, Singed's goo, Sion's slow etc

As a personal vison :
juggernaut players are not huge fans of successfully placing a combination of complex skillshots or high risk high reward situations
skill on their part should be more focused on placement or « dance » with their opponent's placement which is even more enphasis by the fact that they dont have much replacement tools

_**theme/feeling of MK**_

A millenar necromant in a giant full body armor swinging a brutal mace and using unholy magic :
- giant full body armor = durable
- swinging his mace should feels slow strong and violent
- he is a force to be reckon with and he knows that which means he is durable, confident and deadly like a slow, steady, unvoidable death menace 
- second part of his theme is the necroment part while he can resurect the dead, play with corpses, drain life or make the life flow from one person to another, his own body is probably altered by necromancy willingly or accidentaly perhaps which makes him more durable or in need of a full body armor 
this magic is not flashy nor fast it's again slow and steady
- supports an ally with an iron shield, healing him or using him to damage nearby opponent
- last part was not there at first it's the dragon slaying thing, he can interact with the dragons or create ghost of them or maybe his armor is made of dragon scales of he could use dragon magic 
- he does'nt use deception or tricks

**_The major feeling simply put i can get is : unvoidable death_**

With that i tryed to be as close as possible to the ideas i've described above respecting the sub class and reminded by his previous spells
I could'nt keep everything
i left aside everything corpse related as it felt too close to Yorick, support things (my choice) and the shield component (i choose healing)
i also left aside the actual ult which is way too feast or famine to my taste, killing an enemy champion should be the reward in itself
his ressource is gone so he is back to mana (he is a necroment after all)
Again hope you'll like it
